# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

Here is the Julia code for the task. 

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    current_line = ""
    result = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width || !isempty(current_line)
            current_line *= "\n"
        end
        
        current_line *= "$word "
        
        if length(current_line) >= text_width
            result *= current_line[1:text_width]
            current_line = current_line[text_width+1:end]
        end
    end
    
    if !isempty(current_line)
        result *= "\n" * current_line
    end
    
    return strip(result)
end
```

When you use this function on the example data like `wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")`, it will produce:

```julia
"This funct\nion wil\nl wrap\nwords in\nto lines"
```
